articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
üåà GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, we were joined by co-founders Luke and Kui who gave us an overview of Koinos Account Protocol (KAP).
üåü Developer Spotlight
Kui and Luke are co-founders of the Koinos Account Protocol but previously were on DevNTell showcasing their first project, BurnKoin. Kui is a structural engineer from New York but has a deep passion for web3 that drove him to found KAP with Luke. Luke is a software developer by trade, spending the last decade doing web development but has dived into web3 only in the last couple of years. Fun fact: Luke and Kui have founded two projects together but have never met in real life yet!
üî• About KAP
From the KAP About Page:
KAP makes it easy to access dApps without buying tokens. You just get a free or premium username and go. Built on the Koinos blockchain, KAP is the backbone of social, gaming, and any other free-to-use dApp. It will evolve to include a host of features that make it easy to experience blockchain for free.
Resources:
 KAP website
 KAP Whitepaper
 KAP Twitter
ü§ù Guests
Luke: https://twitter.com/lukemwillis
Kui: https://twitter.com/kuixihe

üé• Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xJAPbmlxp3c
articles.title: DevNTell - Koinos Account Protocol

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
üåà GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, we were joined by Josh Stein and Dev Bear who gave us an overview of how to deploy a rollup with a Celestia Light Node.
üåü Developer Spotlight
Josh is a tech enthusiast who likes building with and playing with the latest gadgets and software. Hes on the DevRel team at Celestia Labs and will be sharing more about modular blockchains. When hes not at the computer, he likes biking, swimming, and bouldering.  
Dev Bear is a software engineer at heart having previously held a Senior Software Engineering role at Apple; however, he left his position to co-found Bearchain: A DeFi-focused EVM-compatible L1 built on the Cosmos SDK, powered by Proof of Liquidity Consensus. Dev works closely with Josh and some other Celestia folks on integrating Bearchains EVM framework.
üî• About Celestia
From the Celestia Docs:
Celestia is a modular blockchain network whose goal is to build a scalable data availability layer, enabling the next generation of scalable blockchain architectures - modular blockchains. Celestia scales by decoupling execution from consensus and introducing a new primitive, data availability sampling
Resources:
 Presentation slides
 Celestia
 Celestia Docs
 Quasar App
 How-to-guide to run the demo shown in the presentation  
ü§ù Guests
Josh: https://twitter.com/JoshCStein
Dev: https://twitter.com/itsdevbear

üé• Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jAxbpFQQ-Cg
articles.title: DevNTell - Deploying your own rollup with Celestia

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
üåà GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, we were given an overview of Aspecta by Chief of Staff Jane Yang.
üåü Developer Spotlight
Jane is a founding team member of Aspecta, a startup building digital identity for developers. Before joining Aspecta, she studied AI and interned at a venture capital fund where she was first exposed to web3. During grad school, Jane met Aspecta's Founder, Jack, whose company was exclusively AI-focused. However, Jane's insight led her to introduce Jack to web3 and offered to drop out of grad school if the company pivoted accordingly. The rest is now history with Jane acting as Chief of Staff.
üî• About Aspecta
From the Aspect Docs:
Aspecta ID is an AI-generated identity system, including personal webpages, soul-bound tokens, and digital twins in the metaverse, for pioneering builders, innovators and beyond. The mission of Aspecta ecosystem is to provide safe, user-controllable, and intelligent protocols for users and third-party applications to store, transfer, and utilize data across Web2 & Web3 spaces.
Resources:
Website: https://aspecta.id/
Docs: https://docs.aspecta.id/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/aspecta_id
Medium: https://news.aspecta.id/
Jane's Twitter: https://twitter.com/janeyang0515

üé• Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TnX2YrqMRqU
articles.title: DevNTell - Aspecta

articles.author: Narbeh Shahnazarian
articles.description:
üåà GM
In this week's episode of DevNTell, we were given an overview of Bifrost by Co-Founders Kartik (CEO) and Samraaj (CTO).
üåü Developer Spotlight
Kartik and Samraaj are long-time friends who first met at RIT and then eventually became co-founders together. They started their first business in web3 by creating a smart contract based deadman switch which helped land both of them into Y-Combinator. After a while, they realized that the market conditions weren't quite right for that product to take off and turned to another project that Samraaj had been working on a few years ago. That product was the non-AI version of Bifrost which, at the time, didn't scale since machine-generated code was still relatively new; however, with the recent advancements in AI and after its incorporation into Bifrost, they quickly went viral after releasing their first demo video. They're on a mission to remove all the monotonous work of implementing design so that engineers can focus on the fun stuff!
üî• About Bifrost
Bifrost uses AI to turn your Figma designs into clean React code  automatically. It's the first design-to-code product that works!
Resources:
Bifrost: https://www.bifrost.so/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/bifrostcode
Kartik's Twitter: https://twitter.com/sathaxe
Samraaj's Twitter: https://twitter.com/samraaj

üé• Presentation



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-V_OxKT4yI
articles.title: DevNTell - Bifrost
